question: How does the brain process visual information and can you generate an image of a neuron?

steps.content: How does the brain process visual information and can you generate an image of a neuron?
Plan: 1) Search for how the brain processes visual information. 2) Generate an image of a neuron. 3) Return the answer.
Searching for how the brain processes visual information.
The brain processes visual information through the visual cortex, where signals from the eyes are interpreted.
Generating an image of a neuron.
Can you explain the role of the visual cortex in more detail?
Plan: 1) Search for detailed information on the role of the visual cortex. 2) Return the answer.
Searching for detailed information on the role of the visual cortex.
The visual cortex is responsible for processing visual information, including recognizing shapes, colors, and motion. It is located in the occipital lobe of the brain.
